Class ExtMath

java.lang.Object
  ExtMath

public class ExtMath
extends java.lang.Object

A collection of mathematical functions not offered by the standard class Math in the Java API.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Eric Steegmans

Method Detail

areAddable

public static boolean areAddable(long a,
                                 long b)
Check whether the given integer numbers can be added.

Parameters:
a - The first integer number to be checked.
b - The other integer number to be checked.
Returns:
If the given integer numbers are both positive, true if a does not exceed the largest possible value in the type long diminished with b; false otherwise. | if ( (a > 0) && (b > 0) ) | then result == (a <= Long.MAX_VALUE - b)

add

public static long add(long a,
                       long b)
                throws AddOverflowException
Return the sum of the given integer numbers.

Parameters:
a - The left operand for the addition.
b - The right operand for the addition.
Returns:
The sum of the given numbers. | result == a + b
Throws:
AddOverflowException - [must] The given integer numbers cannot be added. | ! areAddable(a,b)

areMultipliable

public static boolean areMultipliable(long a,
                                      long b)
Check whether the given integer numbers can be multiplied.

Parameters:
a - The first integer number to be checked.
b - The other integer number to be checked.
Returns:
If the given integer numbers have the same sign, true if the absolute value of a does not exceed the largest possible value in the type long divided by the absoulte value of b; false otherwise. | if ( ( (a > 0) && (b > 0) ) || | ( (a < 0) && (b < 0) ) ) | then | result == | (Math.abs(a) <= Long.MAX_VALUE / Math.abs(b))

times

public static long times(long a,
                         long b)
                  throws TimesOverflowException
Return the product of the given integer numbers.

Parameters:
a - The left operand for the product.
b - The right operand for the product.
Returns:
The product of the given numbers. | result == a * b
Throws:
TimesOverflowException - [must] The given integer numbers cannot be multiplied. | ! areMultipliable(a,b)

gcd

public static long gcd(long a,
                       long b)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Return the greatest common divisor of the given integer numbers.

Parameters:
a - The first integer number for which the greatest common divisor must be calculated.
b - The other integer number for which the greatest common divisor must be calculated.
Returns:
The resulting value divides both integer numbers a and b. | (a % result == 0) && (b % result == 0)
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - [must] At least one of the given integer numbers is negative. | (a < 0) || (b < 0)
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - [must] Both integer numbers are 0. | (a == 0) && (b == 0)

sign

public static int sign(long a)
Return the sign of the given integer number.

Parameters:
a - The given integer number.
Returns:
+1 if the given integer number is positive; -1 if the given integer number is negative; 0 if the given integer number is 0. | if (a > 0) | then result == 1 | else if (a < 0) | then result == -1 | else | result == 0
